column4: incarnadine: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=2203165
Can anyone let me know if I need to install the proprietary ATI drivers on my machine?
look here http://wiki.cchtml.com/index.php/Hardware and here http://ati.amd.com/support/drivers/linux64/linux64-radeon.html
but make sure that you get the correct cpu chip type downloaded
My card is listed on the fglrx page... does that mean it will work without the dati drivers?
i just installed yesterday. you have to research that. so far though, after my install, my machine seems to be fine
I guess I don't understand what the difference is between fglrx and the ati drivers... why I would use one over the other one.
what video card are you installing?
oh, i installed AtI X200 so it is about the same
so you did fglrx?
do these checks on your command line http://wiki.cchtml.com/index.php/Frequently_Asked_Questions
libGL warning: 3D driver claims to not support visual 0x4b
are you getting that as a message from one of the commands?
yeah... glxinfo
man glxinfo to see what it checks
but none of the glx stuff is coming up in the other commands i put in
i see that there is no man page for it. i do see also that it has a lot of info
I lookd in synaptic and saw that fglrx is NOT installed.
maybe you need it. have you done a search on the ubuntu forum to see what others experienced
did you install the ATI driver?
no
well that is how i installed it
did you just download the xorg driver?
